What is the purpose of the "name" field in a VerusID?
The "name" field in a VerusID is a unique identifier for the identity, which can be obtained from the output of a RegisterNameCommitment.

the unique name for this identity - Take from
                      RegisterNameCommitment's output - name
   "parent": "IDParent",    (string, required for IDs with parents other than VRSC)
					  the parents friendly name e.g. gravity
   "primaryaddresses": [    (array of strings, required) the trasparent/public address(es)
    "hexstr"
   ],
   "minimumsignatures": 1,   (int, required)
                      MofN signatures required out of the primary addresses list
                      to sign transactions
   "privateaddress": "hexstr", (string, optional)
                      shielded address associated with the VerusID being made
   "revocationauthority": "identityID", (name@ or address, optional)
                      The ID entered here will be able to disable your created ID
                      in case of loss or theft. It is some existing ID which either
                      is under your own control or the ID you trust can help you
                      revoke in case of this ID's theft.
   "recoveryauthority": "identityID"  (name@ or address, optional, required if "revocationauthority"
                      is used)
                      The ID entered here will be able to revive your created ID
                      if it is revoked. It is some existing ID which either is
                      under your own control or the ID you trust can help you
                      revive in case of this ID's revoked.
  }
}
returntx              (bool, optional) default=false if true, retu

What is the "parent" field in a VerusID used for?
The "parent" field in a VerusID is used to specify the friendly name of the parent ID, if the ID has a parent other than VRSC.

What does the "minimumsignatures" field in a VerusID specify?
The "minimumsignatures" field in a VerusID specifies the minimum number of signatures required out of the primary addresses list to sign transactions.

What is the purpose of the "privateaddress" field in a VerusID?
The "privateaddress" field in a VerusID is an optional field that specifies a shielded address associated with the VerusID being created.

What is the "recoveryauthority" field in a VerusID used for?
The "recoveryauthority" field in a VerusID specifies the ID that will be able to revive the created ID if it is revoked. This field is required if "revocationauthority" is used.

the unique name for this identity - Take from
                      RegisterNameCommitment's output - name
   "parent": "IDParent",    (string, required for IDs with parents other than VRSC)
					  the parents friendly name e.g. gravity
   "primaryaddresses": [    (array of strings, required) the trasparent/public address(es)
    "hexstr"
   ],
   "minimumsignatures": 1,   (int, required)
                      MofN signatures required out of the primary addresses list
                      to sign transactions
   "privateaddress": "hexstr", (string, optional)
                      shielded address associated with the VerusID being made
   "revocationauthority": "identityID", (name@ or address, optional)
                      The ID entered here will be able to disable your created ID
                      in case of loss or theft. It is some existing ID which either
                      is under your own control or the ID you trust can help you
                      revoke in case of this ID's theft.
   "recoveryauthority": "identityID"  (name@ or address, optional, required if "revocationauthority"
                      is used)
                      The ID entered here will be able to revive your created ID
                      if it is revoked. It is some existing ID which either is
                      under your own control or the ID you trust can help you
                      revive in case of this ID's revoked.
  }
}

What does the "returntx" option do in a VerusID creation?
The "returntx" option in a VerusID creation is a boolean field that, if set to true, returns the transaction. By default, it is set to false.

                      RegisterNameCommitment's output - name
